key_title: Key to the genera of Thelypteridaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lower surface of veins glabrous or with fine scales or hairs; lower veins of adjacent lobes joined
Lower surface of veins covered in broad, pale brown, papery scales; veins all free
Indusium present (kidney-shaped); fronds variously hairy, at least on lower surface of rachis and veins
Indusium absent; fronds glabrous except for scattered hairs on upper surface of rachis and veins
Lower primary pinnae progressively decreasing in length down rachis, the middle ones at least twice as long as the lowest; pinnae herbaceous, hairy on both surfaces; lobes obtuse, margins flat

Lower primary pinnae all about equal in length, longer than those at the middle of the frond; pinnae coriaceous, upper surface largely glabrous, scales present on lower surface only; lobes acute, margins recurved
